title: Part 4
content:
Part 4

WE SECURED AREA H12 as planned and waited there.

The designated areas weren't expanded at the 1:00 PM event. Neither Class A nor Class B made any significant moves and just like that, it was time for the 3:00 PM update.

The commander contacted Shiraishi and the additional designated areas were announced.

Upon hearing that, Hashimoto and Kanzaki exchanged a glance and then both looked over at me almost simultaneously.

"Looks like the situation's finally changed, huh?"

Up until now, the designated areas had been shrinking inward from the map's outer perimeter, one row at a time.

That pattern was broken for the first time. Rows 4 and 5 and columns K and L all became designated areas. In other words, the remaining area was now shifted slightly southwest of the center.

Class A, which had been staying in F5, would likely now have to hurry toward G8.

And it seemed highly likely that Class B would stay put, not panicking.

If they moved carelessly toward the center, they would also run the risk of being caught in a pincer attack.

One could say Class B's fate depended on whether they regretted not acting sooner, or if they had another plan and remained unfazed.

"We're inside the area and getting too close to the center is kinda sketchy, y'know? If it's the same as yesterday, the area probably won't shrink at the 5 PM event, so is waiting and seeing the right move here?"

Hashimoto muttered, map in hand, saying that was what he would do.

"However, waiting right on the edge of the designated area has its own risks. If we're ambushed ahead of us during the next update, our escape route will be completely cut off."

"I get what you're saying, Kanzaki, but are you suggesting we move forward one whole area? Honestly, a ten-minute time difference is practically nothing."

"We can secure a better position if we move now. If we move to H10, it will be easier to flexibly move in any direction—north, south, east, or west."

Kanzaki pointed with his index finger, indicating that a spot south of the center of the remaining area would be ideal.

"But won't that make it easier for other classes to attack us? What do you think, Ayanokouji?"

"I can't say for certain, but considering how the designated area expanded from the northeast this time, the probability of the mountain being left is extremely low. Moving a little closer now would be the better option. H10 isn't a bad choice."

Moving carelessly too far north or west would only increase the chances of attracting other classes.

Our new destination was a short move to the north. As for supplies, they had appeared at our newly designated destination, H10 and also at J12, so we decided on a policy to retrieve them from just those two locations.

"Form a retrieval squad and send a small group to J12. In the meantime, the rest of us will move to H10. It will probably be our last destination for today."

The third day was entering its latter half, but we decided to continue observing Class A's and Class B's movements.
